Located across from the park and lake in Chicagos Buena Park Historic District, Imperial Towers is a pair of full-amenity high-rise condominiums. The buildings offer picturesque lake, park, and Navy Pier views that are protected by the districts historic neighborhood designation.Residents at the Towers enjoy countless services and amenities. The attentive staff include 24-hour door staff and security, an onsite manager and engineer, and a receiving room. There is an outdoor pool with sundeck, a party room, a fitness room, a laundry room, a dry cleaners, a full grocer, and a new restaurant with bar. The building also offers residents assigned storage, bike storage, and leased garage parking.Separate fees are required for the use of the pool and bike room. Leased parking is $240/month per space.Countless neighborhood amenities are nearby, including Montrose Harbor and Beach, the 18-mile Lakefront Trail, and a 9-hole golf course as well as cafes, restaurants, bars, and shopping. The Jewel-Osco and the new Wilson Yard Target are both conveniently close.The 146 express bus stops right in front of the building, offering fast travel to downtown. It is walking distance to the Wilson Red Line L station, and there is easy access to nearby Lake Shore Drive.This renovated one bedroom, one bath condo offers unobstructed views from its high-floor perch. The living space and bedroom face south, overlooking the park, lake, harbor, and golf course with the downtown skyline and Navy Pier in the distance. Updates include new paint, light fixtures, carpet, windows, bath, and electric service.An entry foyer with coat closet leads into the home. The main living space consists of a large combination living/dining room. The new kitchen features shaker-style cabinets, a full-height mosaic tile backsplash, and stainless steel appliances.The bedroom has a wall of closets, and the bath has a combination tub/shower. Two additional closets are located in the hall.The home is equipped with radiator heating and in-wall air conditioning units in the living area and bedroom. The building does not permit in-unit laundry equipment.If you think this home might be right for you, please call or email us. We are standing by to answer your questions or schedule a time for you to walk through with a member of our team.
LOCATED IN HISTORIC BUENA PARK / SPACIOUS 1 BEDROOM CONDO WITH TONS OF POTENTIAL / UNOBSCURE CITY VIEWS OF LAKEFRONT & WRIGLEY FIELD / FAX ALL OFFERS TO THE OFFICE / NO EMAILS PLEASE.

response.homeDescription: welcome home to this oversized and updated single family home on this beautiful tree-lined avenue in quiet edgewater with 5 beds & 2 full baths all upstairs and a newer half bath on the main living level. Keys features include restored vintage detailing throughout including original woodwork and hardwood flooring. The 2009 renovations included a renovated sunny eat-in kitchen and a new third floor addition with a large master suite with full master bath and organized closet systems with storage. The other 4 bedrooms are on the 2nd level with a full hall bath and bonus tandem study room. Lots of storage and a great floor plan. the 2016 renovation included stripping the millwork, trim and updating the electrical and lighting and a fresh coat of paint in the living room and foyer. The large oversized rear yard includes a 2 car garage off the alley and a huge old growth tree in back. There is ample room for grilling and outdoor dining on the patio area too. The walk-out lower level is partially finished with a rec room for tv and gaming & a large office area plus laundry and workshop with lots of additional storage. the huge welcoming front porch on one of the best blocks in edgewater glen makes this home a must see. walkscore. Com says this home has a walk score of 90 out of 100. This location is a walker's paradise so daily errands do not require a car. This home is a 13 minute walk from the red line at the granville stop. Nearby parks include senn park, wayne park and emmerson park. There are about 272 restaurants, bars and coffee shops in edgewater with a cvs, walgreens and whole foods at the end of the block on broadway right by lickity split custards & sweets! people in edgewater can walk to an average of 11 restaurants, bars and coffee shops in 5 minutes and this home is about 8 blocks to the lake michigan beaches and bike trail to downtown. peirce elementary international studies school is a 17 minute walk according to cps and great schools ranks this 7 out of 10.

response.homeDescription: Pattington! An Exquisite Vintage Home in a Historic building. Lovely 2-bedroom, 1.1-bath condo is on the 2nd floor and boasts a welcoming foyer, formal living room with gas/WBFP and large formal dining room with balcony. Other features include hardwood floors, great architectural details, crown moldings and woodwork throughout. Kitchen with a butlers pantry and dishwasher. A home office. "Although the Pattington`s architect, David Postle, remains relatively unknown, the Pattington, built in 1902, is considered by local architects to be the best example of a style that flourished from the turn of the century to the late 1920s when apartment living in the city was beginning to acquire respectability and a wave of building was underway. In 1980 the Pattington was placed on the National Register of Historic Places". Assessments incl heat/cable. Building in process of converting freight elevators to passenger (no special). Community patio area w/grills. Just steps to Lake and express bus!

response.homeDescription:
Located in picturesque Buena Park, one half block from the lakefront, this high first-floor condo offers approximately 1,300 square feet of living space with two bedrooms and two full baths. 24-hour permit parking makes it easy to park on the block, and reasonably priced garage parking is nearby.
You enter the home through a foyer and into the spacious front living room and sunroom. Down the hall is a separate formal dining room that doubles as a family room. The updated south-facing kitchen includes new porcelain floors, granite countertops, an onyx backsplash, and stainless steel GE appliances.
The master bedroom includes a ceiling fan and an en suite bath with a furniture-style vanity and a combined tub/shower with subway tile. Both the master and the second bedroom have oversized windows with wood blinds and closets with custom organizers. The second bedroom has proximity to the hall bath.
Other features include original hardwood floors and decorative molding and a stacked Maytag washer/dryer.
There is also a covered private deck (soon to be replaced and expanded) and a shared patio and garden perfect for grilling and al fresco dining.
This 6-unit brick walk-up is located on one of the quietest one-way streets in the Buena Park neighborhood, surrounded by classic low-rises and a few high-rises. The self-managed association proactively maintains the 1923 building.
There is a shared back patio and garden, individual basement storage units, and a larger common storage space ideal for bikes. The building includes central hot water radiator heating, and Residence #1 offers four window A/C units and a security system. A few years ago, the building was tuckpointed and its roof resealed.
Historic Buena Park is known to have of the citys best collections of Prairie-style homes and vintage walk-ups. The neighborhood is convenient to transportation, lakefront recreation, and shopping, dining, and nightlife.Walk to the 9-hole Sydney R. Marovitz Golf Course, Montrose Harbor and Beach, the Magic Hedge bird sanctuary, and the 18-mile Lakefront Trail. Local restaurants include an eclectic mix of upscale and ethnic options from Mexican, Argentinean, and Peruvian to Japanese, Indian, and Thai. A Whole Foods Market and a Target are also just a few blocks away.
The 146 express bus to Michigan Avenue and the Loop is steps away, it is walking distance to the Sheridan Red Line L station, and there is easy access to Lake Shore Drive.

response.homeDescription: Welcome to one of the most unique & restored vintage homes in Chicago. This Andersonville home has had only 3 owners since 1901 and features innumerable vintage finishes, including restored items such as original crown molding, wood framing, built-in buffet, hardware, windows, maple & oak flooring and 9.5' ceilings. Added historic items include light fixtures, sconces, Victorian-style window treatments, an XL custom fireplace with imported Brescia Pernice marble, and more than a dozen custom leaded glass windows. Upgrades include 2010 200 amp electric, 2007 kitchen with 4'10" cabinets & matching granite backsplash, Carrera marble bathroom, some radiant heat flooring, 2008 Space Pac, and a 2007 custom chimney with fireplace using a giant reclaimed hand-carved Alder mantle. There is an open concept in the sitting spaces but a Victorian layout for the kitchen, dining room and eating area overlooking the back yard greenery. This is a rare chance to own a piece of vintage history!

response.homeDescription: This home is a Real Estate Owned (REO)/Post Foreclosure. Once a lender has foreclosed on a property it is soon put up for public auction. If bids fall short of the asking price the bank will buy back the home and attempt to sell it on the open market. However, lenders are not real estate agents, meaning that they will often accept offers 30 to 60 percent less than market value!

response.homeDescription: Rare opportunity to get into a single family home in Lakeview for the price of a condo! Charming well cared for vintage home features two levels with three bedrooms and two baths, a basement, yard and garage. The second level has a private master bedroom with a large seating/dressing area and dual closets. A Jack Jill bathroom connects the two upper floor bedrooms. Recent upgrades include a refreshed main floor bathroom, new carpet upstairs (hardwood beneath), new window treatments and new paint throughout. The basement offers plentiful storage space and a washer and dryer. The garage currently is configured for one car but could hold two. The back yard has a nice green space, a deck for outdoor summer entertaining, and a covered porch swing attached to the garage, great for watching the summer action unfold. Walking distance to everything Lakeview has to offer. All in all a perfect home for people that want the privacy of a single family home for the price of a condo!

Hardwood floors feature new moldings. Solid core wood doors. High-end kitchen appliances include wine fridge. Full-size stacked washer and dryer. All new thermal pane glass clears the view while cutting the transmission of heat and cold. Upgraded electrical panel and all new A/C including dual heat/cool bedroom units. New hot H2O heater and new plumbing throughout. Indoor parking, 24-hour front desk staff, exercise room, library, party room, and rooftop swimming pool. It has everything. There's simply nothing else like it at any price anywhere.

response.homeDescription: This stunning Ravenswood home offers approximately 4,077 sqft of gracious, light-filled living space on a wide, tree-lined residential street. Features include new Pella windows and French doors, new hardwood floors, a new kitchen and baths, the addition of the family room, a new third level and a new roof. The main level includes an entry foyer, cozy living and dining rooms, a state-of-the-art kitchen with pantry, and a large family room with fireplace. There are 3 bedrooms and 2 baths (including a luxurious master suite) on the 2nd level. The top level has 2 more bedrooms with a den in the middle. The lower level includes a rec room, a laundry room, and storage. This home is on an over sized 30 x 160 foot lot with great outdoor space including front and rear covered porches, a patio, and a landscaped, suburban sized backyard. Other features include a 2-car garage, and gated parking for a 3rd car.

response.homeDescription:
Our very large 1625 square feet, 2 bedroom, 2 full baths, condo is in the most happening neighborhood�Wrigleyville! Our first floor unit has a new (2006) designer kitchen with stainless Jennaire side by side fridge, Whirlpool stainless slide-in stove, white high end Sears dishwasher, built in white GE microwave, white wood 42 inch Cabinetcraft cabinets with many designer features including glass fronted doors/shelves with interior and under counter lighting, 30 inch wide piecrust front white farm sink with chrome Roehl gooseneck faucet/sprayer. Other kitchen features include: pull out 2 can garbage, spice cabinet, small pullout pantry, corner lazy susan, extra wide drawers for silver with racks, upright pan closet, 4 deep pan drawers, all drawers are lined in cork., bookcase, wine rack, pull out exhaust fan, dish rack and mantel. Granite counters are 2 inch thick Venetian Gold and huge island with ogee edge--WOW.
Our condo has two full tile baths, one with full size tub, one with a large shower, both freshly painted, with pedestal new sink in one and granite vanity top in the other, both have new chrome Brozio designer faucets, new chrome/nickel Pottery Barn lighting, new white wood vintage style medicine cabinets from Williams Sonoma. All the lighting fixtures have been replaced with dimmers throughout house. There are Art Nouveau style chandeliers in dining room and kitchen. Large brick wood burning fireplace. We restored all the window and door surrounds to the originals, installed crown molding, restored all the solid panel doors, all painted white. Round bay facing Addison Street, 4 very large closets and a tall linen closet. Stackable washer/dryer in unit, natural color hardwood floors throughout, carpet in bedrooms (12 x 17 and 10 x 12), and dining room is 12 x 17, living room is 25 x 17.
Neighborhood Description
The Neighborhood is great. Wrigleyville and the Cubs are an anchor for the area. There are great bars and restaurants on Clark. Boystown on Halsted Street is nearby and has great bars and restaurants. We are literally a block from the Red Line Addison Street stop, busses at the door. We have always parked on the street (zoned) and get a free sticker for Cubs parking. There is a great Jewel nearby and Whole Foods is opening up this winter at Halstead and Waveland. Plenty of conveniences, Starbucks, ATMs, Drycleaners, it is a real neighborhood. We feel safe here, our car which we park on the street has never been bothered. Come see for yourself.
response.whatOwnerLoves:
We love the condo and our neighbors. The kitchen is a wonderful addition, and the convenience of having an in unit washer/drier cannot be beat. There are two large closets in the master bedroom, open out with two large doors, all have closet systems, shelves for shoes, bins for summer clothes, more than enough for storage. The second bedroom has a great closet system too. The coat closet by the front door is huge. There is a deep and tall linen closet. New carpet in smaller bedroom (2006) now used as an office. Wired for cable, two phone lines. There is a deck in the back of the unit for grilling. 10 aluminum double paned/screened windows throughout. All new systems: new gas furnace (2005), new gas hot water heater (2004), new washer (2005), new electric drier (2003), new kitchen (2005), new sinks/faucets (2006). A very large locked storage room comes with this unit in the basement; it is at least 6 feet by 10 feet large. We will pay for one full year of off street parking at the LeMoyne School lot as part of this offer at closing. This parking lot is less than a block away. We have always used on street parking (zoned), but you may need off street parking, so we are making this part of the deal, which is worth over $2400. The Condo is self managed, all owner occupied, 9 units. Pet friendly. Excellent financials, condo fees for this unit are a low $206 a month. No special assessments, we already paid for a new roof, repointing the entire building and a new parapet wall at the roof. We take good care of the building and everyone cooperates and gets along.
This is an excellent opportunity to own something that is ready for your special touches. For sale by owner, please no brokers at this time. Check it out!

From the moment you walk into this spacious and inviting two bedroom, vintage condo you will feel right at home. The building that is perfectly situated in a vibrant, desirable Jarvis Square in Rogers Park is exceptionally maintained. You will be captivated by all the charm of this newly renovated condo. The entire unit has been updated with new paint, lighting, flooring, bathroom, yet every inch of this home still boasts historic charm and rare characteristics which have been preserved for a new owner to enjoy. Notice the bead board ceiling in the sun-room / den, 8" oak baseboards, arches and nooks, build in cabinets, solid core doors, and over sized crown moldings and tray ceilings throughout. Each bedroom has a walk-in closet. Just steps away from parks, lake, beach, library, restaurants, shopping,"EL", public transportation. No wonder Chicagoist named Rogers Park the "best neighborhood in Chicago".

response.homeDescription:
Spacious duplex-up 2bd/2ba penthouse in Andersonville. 2100 s/f on two levels with treetop views in an intimate 6 unit building on an elegant, tree-lined street. Brand new in 2000, Unit 3E boasts gleaming oak floors throughout. The open-floor-plan living area features a cooks kitchen with stainless steel appliances and sparkling black granite tops which opens into the great room with its cathedral ceiling, skylights and ceiling fan. A fireplace with gas logs, convertible to wood-burning with gas starter and a separate dining area with a matching granite dining table and built-in seating complete the spacious and comfortable room. The luscious master bedroom has 2 closets and a private marble bath with whirlpool tub. The charming 2nd bedroom also has 2 closets for plenty of storage. Upstairs, the fabulous 700+ s/f loft could be a 3rd BR or a spacious den PLUS office or dining room. Custom lighting, ceiling fans and window treatments, and professional custom paint complete the interior move in and enjoy! A large private deck is accessible from both the master bedroom and the back stairwell for entertaining, grilling and enjoying the sun, stars and fireworks! W/D in unit. Extra storage. Tandem pkg. 4 blocks to Lake Michigan parks and beaches, 2 blocks to the heart of Andersonville. Convenient to Berwyn and Argyle el stations. Tandem Pkg spaces!
Neighborhood Description
Winona is a lovely street with mature trees and vintage architecture. 1224 is midway between the action of Andersonville and the beautiful open spaces along Lake Michigan.
response.whatOwnerLoves:
ANDERSONVILLE is a great neighborhood with restaurants, shops, entertainment and ALSO close to Lake Michigan! Historic Bryn Mawr neighborhood is just up the road, and Uptown with music venues including The Green Mill is a few blocks south.
More photos online at www.SaraMcMurray.com
I love my home because it is warm & comfortable. The loft was originally designed to be a 3rd bedroom, but it also makes a great family room, and there's a bonus room up there that I use as a dining room. The previous owner had an office there.
Having a "great room" really is great - one person can be in the kitchen while another is in front of the fire, and another at the island/breakfast bar helping out. The french doors let in fresh air and the trees provide all the privacy I need. The dining nook with granite to match the kitchen and built-in seating is convenient and cozy!
One great thing about my home is the storage. There are 2 closets in each main floor bedroom! Upstairs there's a utility closet with shelving, and space for things like a vacuum cleaner. If you wanted to use the loft for a 3rd BR there is space to add a closet, and room for a 3rd bath too!
I love, love, LOVE my deck - it's top-floor so it's sunny and warm - we use it year-round! We love to sit outside at night and watch the lights come on and the stars come out. Watching the fireworks going off at the beach is a treat!
East and south-facing windows are THE BEST! We have great morning light, and the sun shines in all winter long! As an artist, I have spent my years here making this house a home. We've got beautiful light fixtures and fans. The windows all have custom window treatments including top-down shades and dramatic full-length drapes in the great room. All of those personal touches stay, of course!
We absolutely love living here, but a job change has us headed for the suburbs. We hope someone who loves the area as much as we do will buy our home and make it their own!

Within a 15 minute walk of the Purple and Red line El stops, and a 1 min walk to the 136 bus (10 minutes into the loop) and 146 bus (30 minutes into the loop), commuting downtown is fast and easy!
Owner Pays for Trash, Sewer, Water, TIVO and Gas. Also included is the exercise room, large sun deck, and Bar-B-Q grills. The Pool is also accessible during the summer months for a fee through the HOA. Tenant is responsible for electric. No Security deposit applied, only a $300 (non refundable) processing fee and first months rent is needed. An additional move-in fee is paid by the Tenant due to the HOA.
Application is based upon proof/review of: - 1+ years at current job - Credit Score of 690 +, Clean Criminal Background Check - Monthly rent cannot exceed more than 33% of monthly job income $1,400 * 3.33 = $4,662 salary needed per month. (Income can be combined with roommate to meet this) - Verifiable good landlord history of 1 or more years from landlords that are schools and/or possible relatives or roommates.

This penthouse west-facing, 600-square foot studio condominium in the Lakeview / Buena Park / Uptown area is in a high-rise building designed by the famous American architect Stanley Tigerman and features floor-to-ceiling windows with a magnificent, 28th-floor city view ? including a view of Wrigley Field. The unit will have brand-new laminate floors (not pictured, installed in April 2017). Concrete walls between units and floors (not visible inside the condo) provide sound abatement.
The condo is two blocks from Montrose beach / Lake Michigan, one block from Lake Shore Drive and the Lake Shore Drive / Michigan Ave. CTA express bus line, and five blocks from the CTA red and purple lines.
